intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. syntomum, commonly known as the short-stemmed buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and basal leaves that are trifoliate or pinnately compound. Its flowers are yellow and borne in umbels, typical of the genus Bupleurum. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
